tags: if anyone's gonna start crying about their ship don't bother bc i won't read it
the r/l haters also love to ship l with elia and arthur but that's another post
summary: What is with all the Dany fans who rightfully can’t stand a Jorah/Dany pairing rooting for Sansa/Tyrion or Sansa/Sandor? It’s...
question: What is with all the Dany fans who rightfully can’t stand a Jorah/Dany pairing rooting for Sansa/Tyrion or Sansa/Sandor? It’s exactly the same if not worse
answer:
It’s not just Dany fans, it’s everyone! I’ve noticed this hypocrisy too (honestly, I think it bothers me more than the shipping itself) and it drives me mad. I see even the fanboy spaces recognize how inappropriate Jorah’s behavior is and how Daenerys doesn’t owe him a thing, but then they’ll clear their throats to proclaim 12 year old Sansa a miserable bitch for not wanting Tyrion? Act like the Hound’s attentions aren’t even worse and that sexual attraction to a child is perfectly normal because she “looks older” and it’s a medieval setting? They’d gag at the thought of him and Arya but Sansa’s fair game? Is she not a child too?

The woke warriors on here like to lambast R+L at every given opportunity in a haze of righteous rage, not for the ruin it caused or for what they did to Elia, but for the age difference and the negative consequences suffered by Lyanna. They can totally see that no adult man has any business with a teenager, not even a 15/16 year old in the ASOIAF universe, but watch them then titter about naughty Sandor wanting his “song” from a barely pubescent Sansa and joyously scream about him crying after she sings, like his ass didn’t hold a knife to her throat and consider raping her ten seconds prior, as well as threatening to kill her more than once. There are actual so called intellectual ASOIAF fan circles where it’s controversial to say there isn’t shit romantic about them, and that what he did to her was vile and traumatizing. This is the hero that’s apparently the only man worthy of Sansa, by the way. It’s funny, because most also hate Littlefinger. They can totally see how his actions are pedophilic, the harm he causes her, how predatory his infatuation is, but the other grown man who harbours sexual feelings for her is romantic as fuck. #BeautyandtheBeastParallelsGuys!!

In my experience, it’s often these crowds that love to turn on Sansa and tear her to pieces when she does something that undermines their creepy pairing- or in the case of the show, outgrows the adult men lusting over her and has no room left for them in her story. It’s why her so called fans like to call her show version “Sandra Bolton”- for what? Being given to monsters and raped?

I wish I knew why these people forget their otherwise rigid moral standing for Sansa and the apparently very radical belief that sexual attraction to children is perverse and fucked up no matter what. But Sansa is a character that’s never really been afforded any compassion by most and never looked at through the lens of the child she still is. She’s also fandom’s favourite romantic self insert for some, and the ultimate prize for angry, broken male characters for others. Put it all together and it makes for the mess we have.

summary: “I am sorry for your girl, Ned. Truly. About the wolf, I mean. My son was lying, I’d stake my soul on it. My son … you love your...
caption:
“I am sorry for your girl, Ned. Truly. About the wolf, I mean. My son was lying, I’d stake my soul on it. My son … you love your children, don’t you?”

“With all my heart,” Ned said.

“With all my heart,” Ned said.

summary: A Pinch of Salt
title: A Pinch of Salt
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2PPslbE

by emmaliza

It did not take long until Sansa confessed that she was still quite inexperienced in life – in those matters above all else. She went red as a pomegranate as she explained, that she didn’t mind being a virgin, really, she was only eighteen and given what her taste in men could be like she ought to be sure before she did anything she would regret, but sometimes she couldn’t help but want…

And Margaery, experienced, helpful Margaery…

tags: i am still not over that hug
thinking about it randomly makes my heart so full
summary:
Mum: You okay?
Me *with tears in my eyes* : uh....yeah 
Mum: What are you thinking?
Me *Jon looked at Sansa as if he had been...
body:
Mum: You okay?

Me *with tears in my eyes* : uh….yeah

Mum: What are you thinking?

Me *Jon looked at Sansa as if he had been starved of looking and her. Then he walked straight into Sansa’s open arms… and they embraced! 😭 After Sansa spent an entire season missing him (“I wish Jon was here”), now she finally got her Jon back… and Jon hugged her after he gave her the “I need You Now” look … From the clip it seems like his face is burried in the crook of her neck!!!!😭 Then Sansa goes into her protective she-wolf mode the second she sees someone behind him😭 … JONSA HUG is the ONLY season 8 clip in the teaser and I WAS NOT EVEN EXPECTING ANOTHER HUG BECAUSE WE ALREADY HAD ONE. NOW WE’RE GETTING ANOTHER ONE. AND I HAVE A LOT OF F E E L I N G S ABOUT THIS*

Me: …Nothing.

Mum: Sure, you’re fine?

Me:

reblog.comment:
Mum: You okay?

Me *with tears in my eyes* : uh….yeah

Me *Jon looked at Sansa as if he had been starved of looking and her. Me:

summary: GoT Season 8
body:
GoT Season 8

Not gonna lie, season 8 is probably gonna be a plot shit show after the writing in season 7. I mean everything was rushed, things stated in one episode were immediately forgotten or contradicted in the next and I just still seethe with the bullshit of having Arya and Sansa squabble.

Don’t even get me started with the whole Tyrion and Daenerys back and forth about the death sentence after she wins the battle with the Lannisters, like, seriously? Why did they have him argue? Was it death by fire that made him apprehensive or the fact it was a “great house” or just because these are people from his homeland.

Because he seemed perfectly fine at the end of season 6 to take control of the meeting with the masters and watch them die so I’m just gonna blame that on the writers.

Just don’t get your hopes up for the same storytelling quality in previous seasons. The only thing I’m sticking around for is the appearance of Drogon and Rhaegal, the battles and to see who wins or dies at the conclusion.

blog.name: kannuckthewolf
blog.title: Too Gay to Function
blog.description: Too opinionated for my own good

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: Guys...
body:
Guys…

Why is it that people are like “Sansa’s gonna betray Jon!” and I’m just like “why would she?”. There is no reason for her to betray him. Sansa is a survivalist. She needs Jon to be around as a form of protection for herself. If he dies then she’s screwed. Yes, she’s smart and having Arya around will be beneficial along with Bran’s powers, but Jon is a reminder of their old life and has remained true to Stark honor by having intelligent honor. The people of the North follow him. They respect him. Who knows how they’ll respond to him working with Daenerys Targaryen and pledging himself to her, but we’ll have to wait and see.

Remember, the lone wolf dies while pack survives.
